list_definition.definition: allowed to move where one wants; not shut in, tied, fastened etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The prison door opened, and he was a free man.

list_definition.definition: not forced or persuaded to act, think, speak etc in a particular way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You are free to think what you like.
He is always free with his money/advice.

list_definition.definition: frank, open and ready to speak

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Alan was known for his free and easy manner.

list_definition.definition: not working or having another appointment; not busy

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I shall be free at five o’clock.

list_definition.definition: (with ofor from) without or no longer having (especially something or someone unpleasant etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She is free from pain now.

list_definition.definition: (with fromor of) to rid or relieve (someone) of something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was able to free herself from her debts by doing lots of overtime.

list_ex_of_english: Though advertising revenue freed the press from direct political control, it introduced its own form of constraints on an expanding press in the 20th century.
No one freed us, and nobody brought us food, and nobody tended us.
Open final syllables are usually long, and there is a freer distribution of consonants in finals than in (unstressed) initial syllables.
The healing process involves correcting imbalances and freeing blockages, thus restoring a proper energy flow through the body.
At the same time, direct government provision also frees up resources for the private agent by reducing its investment borrowing needs and installation costs.
Only a bipedal posture frees both hands, allowing them to assume differential functions and thereby strengthen a lateral bias.
If a whole industry is swept aside because of failing entrepreneurship, resources would be freed for other, expanding sectors.
The judge can exhibit similar candor if he instead believes that the procedural infraction freed a borderline case of a guilty man.
